definition: meticulous planning and careful accounting (idiom)
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: To sensible men, every day is a day of reckoning. (J. W.
sentences.chinese: 對聰明人來說，每一天的時間都是要精打細算的。

sentences.english: If you want to save money to buy a new digital camera, you have to make every cent count.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想儲錢買一部新的數碼相機，你便要精打細算。

sentences.english: Living with a paper-clip counter had its challenges.
sentences.chinese: 與一個精打細算的人生活在一起是一個挑戰。

sentences.english: Miserliness is a capital quality to run in families.
sentences.chinese: 精打細算是一件吝嗇的事。

sentences.english: However we should cogitate for it will soon be spring.
sentences.chinese: 不過我們會精打細算，因爲很快就是春天了。

sentences.english: All I can do is predict you're going to spend it really wisely.
sentences.chinese: 我能夠做的只是預言您的花銷將是非常精打細算的。

sentences.english: Nice calculation is a niggardly thing.
sentences.chinese: 精打細算是一件吝嗇的事。

sentences.english: Abacus symbolizes good fortune and wise decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 算盤象徵好運和精打細算。

sentences.english: With even the biggest spenders starting to scrimp, luxury companies from Chanel S.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，即便是以前出手最闊綽的人也開始精打細算了。
她是一個精打細算的女孩。

definition: to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
hard power (i.e. military and economic power)
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
stake/vital interest/concern
extremely difficult/even more difficult
to haggle over price/to bargain
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
cannot afford/cannot bear the burden
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
foothold
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to force someone to do something
capital/(fig.) asset/advantage/the means (to do sth)
